Application_Facts: Zhou provided passport stamps, credit card statements, bills, leases, and education records showing 1178 days of physical presence in Canada during the four years preceding his application
Residency_Compliance: Yes, 1178 days of physical presence documented, exceeding the 1095-day requirement
Procedural_Issue: Citizenship Judge improperly applied a qualitative test instead of the statutory physical presence test
Evidence_Used: Passport stamps, credit card statements, utility bills, lease agreements, education records
Evidentiary_Deficiency: None; evidence was reliable and sufficient
Decision_Outcome: Citizenship application initially denied by Citizenship Judge
Remedy_Sought: Redetermination of application by another Citizenship Judge
Legal_Standard_Applied: Quantitative physical presence test under s. 5(1)(c)
Decision_Rationale: When an applicant meets the 1095-day physical presence requirement, the qualitative assessment of ties to Canada cannot override compliance with the statutory threshold
Authority_Responsible: Citizenship Commission (via Citizenship Judge), subject to review by Federal Court

Legal_Issue: Was the visa officer's refusal to assess the applicant as a general economist an error in law?
Governing_Law: Under the Immigration Act and Regulations, visa officers must assess applicants based on their claimed occupation unless clearly unqualified.
Outcome: The visa officer erred in law by failing to assess the applicant in her claimed occupation of general economist.
Legal_Provision: Immigration Act and Regulations
Basis_of_Claim: The applicant was not assessed as a general economist despite claiming this occupation.
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Visa officer assessed applicant under incorrect occupations ('manager administration' and 'financial manager') not aligned with application.
Application_Error: Failure to assess applicant in claimed occupation of general economist
Assessment_Standard: Applicants must be assessed based on their claimed occupation unless clearly unqualified
Evidence_Ignored: Applicant's stated intended occupation as general economist
Legal_Standard: Error in law due to misapplication of assessment criteria under the Immigration Act and Regulations
Decision_Outcome: Case remanded for redetermination by a different visa officer
